attributes.text:
Timer, which accelerates after each interval. The initial delay and the interval time can be set using the properties {@link #firstInterval} and {@link #interval}. The {@link #interval} events will be fired with decreasing interval times while the timer is running, until the {@link #minimum} is reached. The {@link #decrease} property sets the amount of milliseconds which will decreased after every firing.

This class is e.g. used in the {@link qx.ui.form.RepeatButton} and {@link qx.ui.form.HoverButton} widgets.
This event if fired each time the interval time has elapsed

Returns the (computed) value of the property decrease.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #decrease}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property firstInterval.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #firstInterval}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property interval.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #interval}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property minimum.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #minimum}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property decrease with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #decrease}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property firstInterval with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #firstInterval}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property interval with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #interval}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property minimum with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #minimum}.

Resets the user value of the property decrease.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #decrease}.

Resets the user value of the property firstInterval.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #firstInterval}.

Resets the user value of the property interval.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #interval}.

Resets the user value of the property minimum.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #minimum}.

Sets the user value of the property decrease.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #decrease}.

Sets the user value of the property firstInterval.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #firstInterval}.

Sets the user value of the property interval.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #interval}.

Sets the user value of the property minimum.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #minimum}.
Decrease of the timer on each interval (for the next interval) until minTimer reached.
Interval used for the first run of the timer. Usually a greater value than the “interval” property value to a little delayed reaction at the first time.
Interval used after the first run of the timer. Usually a smaller value than the “firstInterval” property value to get a faster reaction.
This configures the minimum value for the timer interval.
